I have, however, had long range ion probes where i have felt a bigger tank would come in handy. I guess i should head for the hills now before the flaming torches and pitchforks start heading my way.

Witch!

Witch!

Lawl, so much burning.

Anyways, im of the opinion that (maybee for a future update) squad should consider allowing procedural fuel loading in every tank. That way i can pick anything from small to large, and just fill it up with whatever fuel percentages i want. I can shove a jumbo-64 full of xenon (not that id do that as its crazy), or make the super tiny xenon tank LF storage. Its let us use whatever tanks look the best, and then fill them with whatever resource happens to be the most beneficial to us.

Not something i expect in 1.0, but perhaps 1.1 or some future update.

Anyways, until then, ill just do what ive started doing fairly recently, if i want to use a round-8 for xenon storage under .90, i just edit the .craft and assign the tank to use a equivalent mass of xenon as there was LFO in it. Same with LF, if i only want LF, and no oxy, ill just edit the tank's properties (this is cfg independent, can be saved on each individual craft) to be all LF. I dont consider this a cheat or exploit as im keeping equivalent fuel mass in it, im just making that fuel be the specific type i want it to be, instead of a predetermined option.

i personally never used the tank, and the 1.0 change to xenon may make it actually useful for my style, but i still think a lfo version should be availeable as many many players use it.
